summary: **Decision:** Created comprehensive Transformers.js guide repository (https://github.com/consigcody94/transformersjs-guide) as all-in-one learning resource combining documentation, tutorials, examples, and starter templates. **Problem:** User requested GitHub repository with complete information about Transformers.js for building next-generation WebAI applications; needed to cover all features (NLP/vision/audio/multimodal), provide working examples, and offer production-ready templates. **Alternatives:** Simple README only (rejected: insufficient depth), tutorial-only approach (rejected: no reference docs), docs-only (rejected: no practical examples), iterative minimal v1 (rejected: incomplete value). **Trade-offs:** Large initial scope (14 files, 2,716 LOC) vs iterative approach; accepted comprehensive v1 to provide immediate value with clear structure for expansion; documentation structure ready but tutorials/integrations/demo-app deferred for future. **Impact/Scope:** Establishes reusable pattern for creating comprehensive technical guide repositories; documents 2025 Transformers.js v3 research findings (2000+ models, 1.4M users, WebGPU support, 27 tasks across 4 modalities). Published open-source MIT-licensed project ready for community contributions. **Pattern:** Comprehensive guide repository structure: (1) README as complete overview with features/quick-start/examples/resources, (2) docs/ organized by audience (getting-started/, tutorials/, guides/ by domain, integrations/ by framework, api-reference/), (3) examples/ with working HTML+JS demos organized by modality, (4) starter-template/ with framework-specific boilerplates (vanilla-js complete, react/nextjs/vue/nodejs structured), (5) demo-app/ for all-in-one showcase. Each example includes: working code, README with explanations, performance notes, troubleshooting. Key deliverables: Installation guide (CDN/NPM/Node.js), Quick-start guide (5-min to first model), Sentiment analysis example (production UI), Vanilla JS starter (Vite+ES modules), Contributing guidelines. Researched via WebSearch: Transformers.js v3 WebGPU capabilities, model ecosystem, browser support (70%), performance benchmarks.
